intro: Eufragia latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf eufragia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant features broad, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of bright red or orange tubular flowers. It is often found in coastal or mountainous regions where it thrives in full sun. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
